Tyrael stood and banged his fist on the table.

Tyrael: Enough! Both of you! Your tempers are explosive, so please
direct them at the Preds rather than at each other. Now, if both me
and Dragoon will go for Hydras, you will all have to hold the rest of
them back, especially you, Synergy.

Dreadplague rose a hand.

Dread: You forget another asset. I could hold them down massively by
causing them fear. It would at least slow them an make it easier for
us to slaughter them.

Tyrael: This has merit... Will you all be up to it?

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Rudra656@a... wrote:
> ::Kaiser::
>        He turns to face her and glares darkly.  "By killing anyone who 
> disagreed.  I was successful because I don't waste resources.  It
will take 
> two bots to eliminate Hydras.  I think Tyrael and the Dragoon are
our best 
> choices.  Call it a hunch.  Either way, your job is to follow
orders, not to 
> be bitter that they were chosen for the prestigious assignment over
you."
> 
>        He continues to glare taking a step toward Synergy, a fierce 
> determination glowing in his eyes.  "Frankly, I know they aren't the
best 
> warriors here, I am.  But they should suffice for Hydras.  The rest
of the 
> battle will be equally intense, I assure you.  Although their exact
numbers 
> are unknown to me at this time, I am quite certain they will
outnumber us.  
> That means you may well have to fend off two bots on your own,
unless of 
> course, you don't think you can handle it."  He finally turns his
dark eyes 
> back to Tyrael awaiting his analysis.
